name: sodium silicate production, furnace process, solid product | sodium silicate, solid | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/151/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of sodium silicate solid (100%) from furnace process.;Material and energy inputs as well as waste production and emission to air and water are based on literature sources. Transport and infrastructure are estimation based on a large chemical plant. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of soda, silica sand, and general chemicals at the factory gate

This activity ends with the production of 1 kg of sodium silicate solid (100%). The dataset includes material and energy input, production of waste and emissions for the production of sodium phosphate out of phosphoric acid, transport, infrastructure.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The furnace process is one of the two main processes used to produce sodium silicate. The other one is the hydrothermal process.;;In the furnace process, water glass is produced directly by melting pure silicon sand and soda. Temperatures of approx. 1400 °C are required for this process. The sodium silicate produced can then be used directly in a solid form.;;This represents an average technology in Europe.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
The solid portions of the surface of the Earth consist predominantly of silicon and oxygen atoms in the form of silica and silicates. The use of Earth’s silica and silicate resources is thus the oldest technology on the planet. Nowadays, the range of application of silica and silicates is mainly in the following three fields: detergents, chemicals, adhesives. As a detergent ingredient or wash alkali, sodium silicates raise the pH value and dirt and textile fibres become more strongly negatively charged increasing their mutual electrostatic repulsion. Apart from this, the hardness components of the water are eliminated by complex formation.
